column4: Hello. My baseline memory usage is 600MB. Can someone please suggest how to lower this number?
-/+ buffers/cache:        621        377
This is not a normal memory usage.
run top, press M to sort by memory, what are near the top?
M is shift+m, that is
A few programs that I will not close.
Namely, pidgin, dropbox, compiz.real, Xorg.
Chromium takes a rather big chunk of memory but that's not baseline so I don't consider that.
In total, the top 4 programs are running ~150MB.
Top 10 is ~200MB.

I'm not sure if the xorg and compiz memory usage is real memory of the graphics board memory... some of the X memory at least is that, could be that compiz's memory is too if it shares memory with X server
The rest are measured in kilobytes.
I don't understand.
never mind.
Right-o.
So, I don't get why so much of my memory is being used baseline.
I really don't see how GNOME can be run with 256MB RAM.
I think my booted up Ubuntu uses about 500 MB of memory for the baseline stuff it's running... The real memory usage is 800 MB but 300 MB is going to Eclipse
(Though many people say they do.)
Why does Ubuntu use so much damn memory?
And is there any way to fix it?
long tail of small programs adds up, I guess.
